results.title: Accidents will happen
results.creator_credit: Cinemedia, XYZ, Fabienne Nicholas and Guy Richards
results.brief_description: In an attempt to pay his son’s medical bills following an unfortunate accident, a father (Brett Swain) sends in handicam footage of Timmy’s mishap into the reality show, “Accidents will happen”. His wife (Anni Finsterer) is bitterly disappointed, but makes the journey into the studio with the family when they are in contention for a financial benefit. When the production crew discover the faux accident has resulted in Timmy becoming wheelchair bound, they send down an executive (Chris Haywood) to reneg the claim and all appears to be lost. A timely tale about reality television that featured as part of the St Kilda Film Festival and Touring Film Festival, 1999. Cast also includes Michael Barrallon, Emily Barr, Alan Dale and Tania Lacy.

results.title: Accidents of creation
results.creator_credit: Andrew Liebman, Paula S. Apsell, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Cracking the code”.
DNA, a simple chemical, defines the difference between every living animal and plant on earth. Differences arise from mutations; small changes in DNA working as the engine of evolution.

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 5: safe clothing
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Mulholland and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: Brogan thinks Foreman McCardle has gone clean off his rocker when he has him, Brogan, carted away to the clinic although he’s perfectly well. When Nurse Gilfillan starts to operate - on Brogan’s trailing necktie, baggy-sleeved sweater, cuffed pants and worn-out shoes - horrid tales of workers who had worn similar clothing and been reduced to near-hamburger make everything quite clear. Cast: Joseph Carr, Marcia Diamond, Alfie Scopp

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 4: falls
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Fred Lasse and Donald Mulholland
results.brief_description: Spotlights the most common causes of serious falls in industry. While an ironic commentary suggests new and better ways of tripping people up, we see workers drop truck handles in the aisles, neglect loose floor boards, leave pails on stairs, climb on rickety boxes, and use an extension ladder without safety feet. The film ends with practical advice on how to eliminate factory danger spots that may result in bad falls.

results.title: Accident prevention: look before you leap
results.brief_description: That this number one safety rule has special application to vacationers is illustrated in this animated film which tells the story of a cyclist who didn’t look before he leaped. After pedalling uphill to a precipitous cliff he decided he’d like to cool off in the inviting water below, and dived right in without first looking. The result - one less cyclist, and one more statistic to support the warning: “Dive only into deep water.”

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A serious accident brings a tragic end to the dreams and ambitions of a young migrant worker. Looks at the rights of workers and the responsibility of management in industrial accidents. Opens up for consideration the alternatives of Workers Compensation or suing under judge made law.

results.title: Accident
results.brief_description: An Oxford undergraduate is killed in a car crash; his tutor looks back over the tangle of personal relationships that contributed to his death. This screenplay by Harold Pinter, based on the novel by Nicholas Mosley, is a fascinating, if uneven, study of a teacher who becomes involved with his student. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael York and Jacqueline Sassard.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Martin Duckworth and Pat Crawley
results.brief_description: The subject is the actual crash of a small plane in which one man survived to tell the story. What he describes is his view of the world now, after being on the edge of death. It is, he says, like being continually stoned - neutral but more fully aware, accepting life without bias, a condition he feels we are all coming to. Award: New York.

results.title: Accessible city doctor Wilfred Owen
results.brief_description: Cities are growing at a calamitous pace and they will be unliveable unless the idea of accidental growth is abandoned in favour of planning. Dr. Wilfred Owen discusses some of the features essential to the functioning of a city for business by day and recreation by night, and the role of transportation in effecting the growth of cities for the benefit of people
